entry.title: Six killed in apartment building explosion in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Six killed in apartment building explosion in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìç A gas explosion in a residential apartment building in the Armenian town of Chambarak killed six people and injured 11 others. üìç The Armenian government launched a pilot program to subsidize companies that hire workers from socially disadvantaged families. üìç Firebird, a San Francisco and Yerevan-based AI cloud company, announced a $500 million public-private partnership with the Armenian government, backed by U.S. tech giant NVIDIA. The funding is for building a major AI infrastructure hub in the country.

entry.title: After Operation Sindoor, India Looks to Armenia

media:group.media:title: After Operation Sindoor, India Looks to Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Abhinav Pandya, Founder and Director of the India-based Usanas Foundation, explores the rapid strengthening of strategic ties between India and Armenia following last month‚Äôs India‚ÄìPakistan conflict, Operation Sindoor. He explains how growing awareness within India‚Äôs government and public of Pakistan‚Äôs close alliance with Azerbaijan and Turkey has pushed India and Armenia closer together, not only in defense, but also in trade, tourism, and infrastructure. Dr. Pandya also examines the vital role of Iran and the challenges with establishing the International North-South Transport Corridor (INSTC), which could connect India to Armenia and onward to Europe.
0:00- Strategic value of Armenia for India 4:46- Conflict has upgraded Armenia-India relations to a strategic partnership 6:33- Changing Indian view against Turkey & Azerbaijan 8:21- Potential effect on Indian tourism to Armenia 10:28- Connecting India and Armenia through Iran 12:34- Challenges posed by Iran's situation 13:19- Syunik's geopolitical importance for India

entry.title: Fines set to rise as Yerevan battles construction violations #shorts

media:group.media:title: Fines set to rise as Yerevan battles construction violations #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Construction site violations across Yerevan have left residents frustrated. City Hall has promised to enforce stricter protective measures and fines to prevent further distress to residents.

entry.title: How Armenia and the International Criminal Court empower each other

media:group.media:title: How Armenia and the International Criminal Court empower each other
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Silvia Fern√°ndez de Gurmendi, former President of the International Criminal Court and a leading voice in international criminal justice, explains why Armenia‚Äôs recent accession to the Rome Statute is a significant step both legally and symbolically. She explores what ICC membership means for smaller states like Armenia, how the court has evolved over the past two decades, and why international justice remains challenging in a politically fractured world. Dr. Fern√°ndez also outlines how Armenia can play an active role in strengthening the ICC and why cooperation among member states is crucial for the court‚Äôs effectiveness and survival.
0:00- What does joining the International Criminal Court mean for Armenia? 2:00- How has the ICC evolved since its founding? 3:57- Criticism against the ICC 5:30- How ICC prioritizes which cases it hears 8:33- What can Armenia do to strengthen the ICC? 10:08- ICC‚Äôs biggest challenges today
